author: Pat Brans
description:
As drones become cheaper, smarter, and weaponized at scale, the new battlefield demands fast, scalable, and affordable defenses.

The post Counter-UAS technology enters a new era  appeared first on EE Times.
title: Counter-UAS technology enters a new era

author: Yashasvini Razdan
description:
India’s new Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS) has sparked $13 billion in proposed investments, drawing strong interest from global players like TDK, Murata, and JJMicroelectronics—all expanding local manufacturing, R&D, and partnerships to strengthen India’s role in the global electronics supply chain.

The post Global Component Makers Deepen India Ties Under New Manufacturing Push   appeared first on EE Times.
title: Global Component Makers Deepen India Ties Under New Manufacturing Push

author: DECO Integration Technology Co., Ltd
description:
Shenzhen, China – October 2025 — DECO Integration Technology Co., Ltd. (“DECO”) today announced the release of the DKV56 series, the world’s first ultra-high voltage mmWave-based wireless isolation gate driver chips. As a next-generation solution for IGBT, MOSFET, and SiC device control, the DKV56 series integrates DECO’s proprietary MillConnex® mmWave Wireless Isolation Technology, achieving breakthroughs […]

The post DECO’s DKV56 Series: First Ultra-High Voltage mmWave Wireless Gate Driver appeared first on EE Times.
title: DECO’s DKV56 Series: First Ultra-High Voltage mmWave Wireless Gate Driver

author: Dr. Doug Milburn, Chairman of the Protocase Companies
description:
Innovation doesn’t fail from bad ideas—it fails from latency. Momentum, not perfection, drives breakthroughs; eliminate delays, embrace iteration, and structure projects for continuous motion.

The post Innovation at Velocity: Why Latency Kills Projects  appeared first on EE Times.
title: Innovation at Velocity: Why Latency Kills Projects
